017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link Supplier} with additional contractual requirements.
037 *
038 * <p><strong>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an
039 * {@link Optional} or a {@link
040 * java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},</strong> despite the
041 * deliberate similarities of some method names.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
044 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
045 * class</a>.</p>
046 *
047 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
048 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
049 *
050 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
051 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
052 *
053 * @see #determinism()
054 *
055 * @see #get()
056 *
057 * @see #optional()
058 */
059@FunctionalInterface
060public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
061
062  /**
063   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
064   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
065   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
066   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
067   * that does occur, including {@link NoSuchElementException} and
068   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
069   * indicate value absence.
070   *
071   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
072   *
073   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
074   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
075   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
076   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
077   * that does occur
078   *
079   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
080   * null}
081   *
082   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
083   * return {@code null}
084   *
085   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
086   * determinism.
087   *
088   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
089   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads,
090   * but the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method of
091   * the supplied {@code handler} may not be.
092   *
093   * @see #get()
094   */
095  @OverridingDiscouraged
096  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
097    try {
098      return this.get();
099    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
100      try {
101        return handler.apply(e);
102      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
103        r.addSuppressed(e);
104        throw r;
105      }
106    }
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}.
111   *
112   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
113   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
114   *
115   * <ul>
116   *
117   * <li><strong>It is deliberately and explicitly permitted for
118   * implementations of this method to return {@code null} for any
119   * reason.</strong> Callers of this method must be appropriately
120   * prepared.</li>
121   *
122   * <li>If an invocation of the {@link #determinism()} method, on any
123   * thread, returns any of {@link Determinism#ABSENT}, {@link
124   * Determinism#DETERMINISTIC} or {@link Determinism#PRESENT}, then
125   * additional requirements apply to the implementation of this
126   * method; see the {@link #determinism()} method documentation for
127   * details.</li>
128   *
129   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic if
130   * an invocation of the {@link #determinism()} method returns {@link
131   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}.</li>
132   *
133   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate the (possibly
134   * transitory) absence of a value by any of the following means:
135   *
136   * <ul>
137   *
138   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.</li>
139   *
140   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
141   *
142   * </ul></li>
143   *
144   * </ul>
145   *
146   * @return a value, which may be {@code null}
147   *
148   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate (usually
149   * transitory) absence
150   *
151   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate (usually
152   * permanent) absence
153   *
154   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
155   * return {@code null}, even in the normal course of events.
156   *
157   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
158   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
159   *
160   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
161   * determinism.  An ideal implementation should be idempotent.  If
162   * the {@link #determinism() determinism()} method returns a {@link
163   * Determinism} that is not {@link Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}, then any
164   * implementation of this method must be deterministic.
165   *
166   * @see #determinism()
167   */
168  @Override
169  public T get();
170
171  /**
172   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link
173   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
174   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
175   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
176   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
177   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
178   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
179   * instances that are used to indicate value absence.
180   *
181   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
182   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
183   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
184   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()} method,
185   * including {@link NoSuchElementException} and {@link
186   * UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
187   * indicate value absence.</p>
188   *
189   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
190   *
191   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
192   *
193   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
194   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
195   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
196   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
197   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
198   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
199   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
200   * instances that are used to indicate value absence
201   *
202   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
203   * null}
204   *
205   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
206   * return {@code null}.
207   *
208   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
209   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
210   *
211   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
212   * determinism.
213   *
214   * @see #get()
215   */
216  @OverridingDiscouraged
217  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
218    T value;
219    try {
220      value = this.get();
221    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
222      try {
223        return handler.apply(null, e);
224      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
225        r.addSuppressed(e);
226        throw r;
227      }
228    }
229    return handler.apply(value, null);
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
234   * on the supplied {@code action} with the return value of an
235   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
236   * null}, unless the {@link #get()} method throws either a {@link
237   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
238   * UnsupportedOperationException}, indicating value absence, in
239   * which case no action is taken.
240   *
241   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
242   * take; must not be {@code null}
243   *
244   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
245   *
246   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
247   * determinism.
248   *
249   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
250   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
251   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
252   * accept(Object)} method may not be
253   *
254   * @see #get()
255   */
256  @Convenience
257  @OverridingDiscouraged
258  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
259    T value;
260    try {
261      value = this.get();
262    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
263      return;
264    }
265    action.accept(value);
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
270   * on the supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
271   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
272   * null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates value absence
273   * by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
274   * UnsupportedOperationException}, invokes the {@link Runnable#run()
275   * run()} method of the supplied {@code absentAction} instead.
276   *
277   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
278   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
279   *
280   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
281   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
282   *
283   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
284   * absentAction} is {@code null}
285   *
286   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
287   * determinism.
288   *
289   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
290   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
291   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
292   * accept(Object)} method may not be and the supplied {@link
293   * Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run() run()} method may not be
294   *
295   * @see #get()
296   */
297  @Convenience
298  @OverridingDiscouraged
299  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
300    T value;
301    try {
302      value = this.get();
303    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
304      try {
305        absentAction.run();
306        return;
307      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
308        r.addSuppressed(e);
309        throw r;
310      }
311    }
312    presentAction.accept(value);
313  }
314
315  /**
316   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
317   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
318   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
319   *
320   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
321   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
322   *
323   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
324   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
325   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
326   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
327   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
328   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
329   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
330   * methods.</p>
331   *
332   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
333   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
334   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
335   *
336   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
337   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
338   *
339   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
340   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
341   * multiple threads.
342   *
343   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
344   * determinism.
345   *
346   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
347   *
348   * @see #get()
349   */
350  @Convenience
351  @OverridingDiscouraged
352  public default Optional<T> optional() {
353    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
358   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
359   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
360   * result.
361   *
362   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
363   *
364   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
365   *
366   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
367   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
368   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
369   * supplied {@code handler}
370   *
371   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
372   * null}
373   *
374   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
375   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
376   *
377   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
378   * determinism.
379   *
380   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
381   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
382   *
383   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
384   *
385   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
386   */
387  @Convenience
388  @OverridingDiscouraged
389  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
390    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
391  }
392
393  /**
394   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
395   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
396   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
397   * result.
398   *
399   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
400   *
401   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
402   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
403   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
404   * with the supplied {@code handler}
405   *
406   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
407   * null}
408   *
409   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
410   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
411   *
412   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
413   * determinism.
414   *
415   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
416   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
417   *
418   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
419   *
420   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
421   */
422  @Convenience
423  @OverridingDiscouraged
424  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
425    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
426  }
427
428  /**
429   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
430   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
431   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
432   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
433   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}.
434   *
435   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
436   *
437   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
438   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
439   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
440   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
441   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}
442   *
443   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
444   * return {@code null}.
445   *
446   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
447   * determinism.
448   *
449   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
450   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
451   *
452   * @see #get()
453   */
454  @Convenience
455  @OverridingDiscouraged
456  public default T orElse(final T other) {
457    try {
458      return this.get();
459    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
460      return other;
461    }
462  }
463
464  /**
465   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
466   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
467   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
468   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
469   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
470   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}.
471   *
472   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
473   * {@code null}
474   *
475   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
476   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
477   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
478   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
479   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
480   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}
481   *
482   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
483   * null}
484   *
485   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
486   * return {@code null}.
487   *
488   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
489   * determinism.
490   *
491   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
492   * msut be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
493   * {@link Supplier#get() get()} method of the supplied {@code supplier}
494   * may not be
495   *
496   * @see #get()
497   */
498  @Convenience
499  @OverridingDiscouraged
500  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
501    try {
502      return this.get();
503    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
504      try {
505        return supplier.get();
506      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
507        r.addSuppressed(e);
508        throw r;
509      }
510    }
511  }
512
513  /**
514   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
515   * may be {@code null}.
516   *
517   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
518   * may be {@code null}
519   *
520   * @exception NoSuchElementException if value absence was indicated
521   * by the {@link #get()} method
522   *
523   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
524   * return {@code null}.
525   *
526   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
527   * determinism.
528   *
529   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
530   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
531   *
532   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
533   */
534  @Convenience
535  @OverridingDiscouraged
536  public default T orElseThrow() {
537    try {
538      return this.get();
539    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
540      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
541    }
542  }
543
544  /**
545   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
546   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
547   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
548   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
549   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
550   * Supplier#get() get()} method.
551   *
552   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
553   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
554   *
555   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
556   * must not be {@code null}
557   *
558   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
559   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
560   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
561   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
562   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
563   * Supplier#get() get()} method
564   *
565   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
566   * null}
567   *
568   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link #get()} method
569   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
570   * UnsupportedOperationException}
571   *
572   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
573   * return {@code null}.
574   *
575   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
576   * determinism.
577   *
578   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
579   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
580   *
581   * @see #get()
582   */
583  @Convenience
584  @OverridingDiscouraged
585  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
586    try {
587      return this.get();
588    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
589      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
590      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
591        throwable.initCause(e);
592      } else {
593        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
594      }
595      throw throwable;
596    }
597  }
598
599  /**
600   * Returns an {@link Determinism} denoting the presence of values
601   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
602   * method.
603   *
604   * <p>Overrides of this method must be compatible with the
605   * implementation of the {@link #get()} method.  Specifically:</p>
606   *
607   * <ul>
608   *
609   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
610   * Determinism#PRESENT}, then the implementation of the {@link #get()}
611   * method must never throw either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
612   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, and, for any two
613   * invocations, on any thread, must return either the same object, or
614   * objects that are indistinguishable from one another and that can
615   * be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
616   *
617   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
618   * Determinism#ABSENT}, then it is expected that any two invocations of
619   * the {@link #get()} method, on any thread, will each throw either
620   * a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
621   * UnsupportedOperationException}.  If an implementation of the
622   * {@link #get()} method instead returns a value, contrary to these
623   * requirements, then the value must be treated as irrelevant or
624   * undefined.</li>
625   *
626   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
627   * Determinism#DETERMINISTIC}, then any two invocations of the {@link
628   * #get()} method implementation, on any thread, must either throw
629   * either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
630   * UnsupportedOperationException}, or must return either the same
631   * object, or objects that are indistinguishable from one another
632   * and that can be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
633   *
634   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
635   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}, then there are no additional requirements
636   * placed upon the implementation of the {@link #get()} method
637   * besides those defined in {@linkplain #get() its existing
638   * contract}.</li>
639   *
640   * </ul>
641   *
642   * <p>Additionally, once an override of this method returns a {@link
643   * Determinism} whose {@link Determinism#deterministic() deterministic()}
644   * method returns {@code true}, then it must forever afterwards, for
645   * all invocations, on all possible threads, return the same {@link
646   * Determinism}.</p>
647   *
648   * <p>If any of the requirements above is not met, undefined
649   * behavior may result.</p>
650   *
651   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@link
652   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}.  Overrides are strongly encouraged.</p>
653   *
654   * @return an {@link Determinism} denoting the presence of values
655   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
656   * method
657   *
658   * @nullability This method does not, and its (encouraged) overrides
659   * must not, return {@code null}.
660   *
661   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  Its
662   * (encouraged) overrides must be idempotent.  They may not be
663   * deterministic (see above).
664   *
665   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (encouraged) overrides must
666   * be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
667   */
668  @OverridingEncouraged
669  public default Determinism determinism() {
670    return Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
671  }
672
673  /**
674   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
675   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
676   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
677   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
678   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
679   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
680   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method.
681   *
682   * <p>Note that this means the sole element of the {@link Stream}
683   * that is returned may be {@code null}.  If this is undesirable,
684   * consider invoking {@link Optional#stream() stream()} on the
685   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method instead.</p>
686   *
687   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
688   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
689   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
690   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
691   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
692   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
693   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method
694   *
695   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
696   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
697   *
698   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
699   * determinism.
700   *
701   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
702   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
703   *
704   * @see #get()
705   */
706  @Convenience
707  @OverridingDiscouraged
708  public default Stream<T> stream() {
709    try {
710      return Stream.of(this.get());
711    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
712      return Stream.empty();
713    }
714  }
715
716
717  /*
718   * Static methods.
719   */
720
721
722  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
723    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
724      return null;
725    } else {
726      throw e;
727    }
728  }
729
730  /**
731   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
732   * method will return the supplied {@link Determinism} and whose {@link
733   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
734   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}.
735   *
736   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
737   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
738   *
739   * @param determinism the {@link Determinism} to use; must not be {@code null}
740   *
741   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} whose {@link #get()} method
742   * will be called; must not be {@code null}
743   *
744   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
745   * method will return the supplied {@link Determinism} and whose {@link
746   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
747   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}
748   *
749   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code determinism} or {@code
750   * supplier} is {@code null}
751   *
752   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
753   *
754   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
755   *
756   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
757   * threads.
758   */
759  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Determinism determinism, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
760    return new OptionalSupplierAdapter<>(determinism, supplier);
761  }
762
763  /**
764   * Invokes {@link Absence#instance()} and returns the result.
765   *
766   * @param <T> the type of the nonexistent value the returned {@link
767   * OptionalSupplier} will never {@linkplain #get() supply}
768   *
769   * @return the result of invoking {@link Absence#instance()}
770   *
771   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
772   *
773   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
774   *
775   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
776   * multiple threads.
777   *
778   * @see Absence#instance()
779   */
780  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of() {
781    return Absence.instance();
782  }
783
784  /**
785   * Returns an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
786   * {@link Supplier}.
787   *
788   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
789   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
790   *
791   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier}; may be {@code null} in
792   * which case the return value of an invocation of {@link
793   * Absence#instance()} will be returned
794   *
795   * @return an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
796   * {@link Supplier}
797   *
798   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
799   *
800   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
801   *
802   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
803   * multiple threads.
804   */
805  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<T> supplier) {
806    if (supplier == null) {
807      return Absence.instance();
808    } else if (supplier instanceof OptionalSupplier<T> os) {
809      return os;
810    } else {
811      return new OptionalSupplierAdapter<>(supplier);
812    }
813  }
814
815  /**
816   * Returns an {@link OptionalSupplier} that will, loosely speaking,
817   * try the supplied {@code supplier} first, and, if it throws a
818   * {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
819   * UnsupportedOperationException} from its {@link Supplier#get()}
820   * method, will then try the supplied {@code defaults}.
821   *
822   * <p>The supplied {@link Supplier} instances can, themselves, be
823   * {@link OptionalSupplier}s, and, if so, the resulting {@link
824   * OptionalSupplier} will have its {@link #determinism()} method
825   * appropriately implemented.</p>
826   *
827   * @param <T> the type of object the returned {@link
828   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
829   *
830   * @param supplier the first {@link Supplier} to try; may be {@code
831   * null}
832   *
833   * @param defaults the fallback {@link Supplier} to try; may be
834   * {@code null}
835   *
836   * @return a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier}
837   *
838   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
839   *
840   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
841   *
842   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
843   * threads.
844   */
845  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<T> supplier, final Supplier<T> defaults) {
846    if (supplier == null) {
847      if (defaults == null) {
848        return Absence.instance();
849      } else {
850        return of(defaults);
851      }
852    } else if (defaults == null) {
853      return of(supplier);
854    } else {
855      return DefaultingOptionalSupplier.of(supplier, defaults);
856    }
857  }
858
859  /**
860   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
861   * method will return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} and whose {@link
862   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}.
863   *
864   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
865   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
866   *
867   * @param value the value the new {@link OptionalSupplier} will
868   * return from its {@link #get()} method; may be {@code null}
869   *
870   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
871   * method will return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} and whose {@link
872   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}
873   *
874   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
875   *
876   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
877   *
878   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
879   * threads.
880   */
881  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final T value) {
882    return FixedValueSupplier.of(value);
883  }
884
885
886  /*
887   * Inner and nested classes.
888   */
889
890
891  /**
892   * A token indicating transitory or permanent presence or absence.
893   *
894   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
895   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
896   *
897   * @see #deterministic()
898   *
899   * @see OptionalSupplier#determinism()
900   */
901  public static enum Determinism {
902
903    /**
904     * An {@link Determinism} indicating an unknown, possibly
905     * transitory, determinism or absence.
906     */
907    NON_DETERMINISTIC(false),
908
909    /**
910     * An {@link Determinism} indicating an unknown permanent presence
911     * or absence.
912     */
913    DETERMINISTIC(true),
914
915    /**
916     * An {@link Determinism} indicating permanent absence.
917     */
918    ABSENT(true),
919
920    /**
921     * An {@link Determinism} indicating permanent determinism.
922     */
923    PRESENT(true);
924
925    private final boolean deterministic;
926
927    private Determinism(final boolean deterministic) {
928      this.deterministic = deterministic;
929    }
930
931    /**
932     * Returns {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
933     * {@link Determinism} is deterministic.
934     *
935     * @return {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
936     * {@link Determinism} is deterministic
937     *
938     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
939     *
940     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
941     * multiple threads.
942     */
943    public final boolean deterministic() {
944      return this.deterministic;
945    }
946
947  }
948
949}
